required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effects of Wearing a Face Mask During CrossFit Exercise
clinical_study.official_title: The Effects of Wearing a Face Mask During COVID-19 on Performance and Intensity Markers During CrossFit Exercise

brief_summary.textblock: Face masks are important for prevention of transmission and contracting viruses such as COVID-19. Gymnasiums have been identified as being susceptible to virus transmission; therefore, wearing face masks during exercise is important during pandemics. This study will evaluate performance and physiological stress during high-intensity exercise while wearing a face mask during Crossfit exercise training.

detailed_description.textblock: Face masks are important for prevention of transmission and contracting viruses such as COVID-19. Gymnasiums have been identified as being susceptible to virus transmission; therefore, wearing face masks during exercise is important during pandemics. This study will evaluate performance and physiological stress during high-intensity exercise while wearing a face mask during Crossfit exercise training. Twenty-four men and women will be randomly assigned to perform exercise during Crossfit exercise while wearing or not wearing a surgical face mask in a cross-over study. Two types of exercise sessions will be assessed: A high intensity interval session and a continuous exercise session. There will therefore be four exercise sessions evaluated in our randomized cross-over design: 1) high intensity exercise while wearing a face mask; 2) high intensity exercise with no face mask; 3) continuous exercise while wearing a face mask; 4) continuous exercise with no face mask. Outcome variables to be assessed include exercise performance during the sessions (total repetitions for pull-ups, push-ups, and squats during continuous exercise and total repetitions for box jumps during high-intensity exercise). Heart rate, rating of perceived exertion, and dyspnea will also be assessed throughout the exercise sessions.

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in box jumps
primary_outcome.description: Number of box jump repetitions during high intensity exercise

primary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in pull-up, push-up, and squat repetitions
primary_outcome.description: Number of repetitions performed for pull-ups, push-ups, and squats

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in rating of perceived exertion
secondary_outcome.description: Rating of perceived exertion on a scale of 1-10 (Modified Borg Scale), a higher score indicates a greater perceived exertion

secondary_outcome.measure: Change from baseline in heart rate

secondary_outcome.description: Dyspnea scale (0-10), a higher score indicates increased dyspnea

arm_group.arm_group_label: high intensity interval training wearing a face mask
high intensity interval training wearing no face mask
continuous exercise training wearing a face mask
continuous exercise training wearing no face mask

intervention.description: High intensity interval training: 6 sets x 8 bench press, 10 pull-ups, and maximal number of box jumps (each set lasting 60 sec, with 4 minutes rest between sets)
intervention.arm_group_label: high intensity interval training wearing a face mask
high intensity interval training wearing no face mask

intervention.description: 5 pull-ups, 10 push-ups, and 15 body-weight squats, repeated for 30 minutes
intervention.arm_group_label: continuous exercise training wearing a face mask
continuous exercise training wearing no face mask

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Experienced with CrossFit exercise training
Exclusion Criteria:
- Contra-indications to exercise as identified by a screening questionnaire (the "Get Active Questionnaire")
